name: Garlic Beef & Broccoli
description: Chinese restaurant-style garlic beef and broccoli. Quick 20-minute dinner packed with protein and vegetables.

instructions.instruction: Toss beef slices with 1 tablespoon cornstarch, salt, and pepper.
Prepare the sauce: Mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, beef broth, remaining cornstarch, and sesame oil.
Heat a wok over high heat. Add oil and heat until smoking.
Add beef in a single layer. Cook without stirring for 1 minute, then stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add broccoli to the wok with 2 tablespoons water. Cover and steam for 2 minutes.
Add garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Return beef to the wok. Pour sauce over and toss.
Cook until sauce thickens, about 1-2 minutes.
Serve hot over rice or on its own.

tips: Slicing beef against the grain ensures tender bites.
High heat and quick cooking (wok hei) creates the best flavor.
Broccoli is rich in vitamin C and fiber.
Perfect for keto when served without rice.
storageInfo: Store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat in a pan to maintain texture.
servingSuggestion: Serve over jasmine rice or cauliflower rice for low-carb option.
variations: Chicken or shrimp can be substituted.
Add bell peppers and snap peas for more vegetables.
